official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House that a Contract with America should restore American
			 competitiveness.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on the

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that a Contract with America should include a roadmap to restore
			 American competitiveness by—

text.#text: That it is the sense of the
simplifying the corporate tax structure with lower statutory rates and no loopholes;
taxing overseas profits earned by American multinational companies only where they are earned;
easing the immigration of highly skilled individuals;
responsibly developing America’s shale-gas and oil reserves;
aggressively addressing distortions and abuses in the international trading system;
improving American logistics, communications, and energy infrastructure;
simplifying and streamlining Federal regulation; and
creating a sustainable Federal budget, including entitlement reform.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: should conclude a Contract with America to restore American competitiveness;

text.#text:
Whereas a Contract with America should include a roadmap to move American competitiveness forward;
			 and

Whereas Drs. Michael Porter and Jan Rivkin have developed an eight point plan to restore American
			 competitiveness: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 745 IH: Expressing the sense of the House that a Contract with America should restore American competitiveness.
